Note:
Compare 3864; for another version, wholly distinct, see 6011; cf. Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, 8401.
Title(s): ‘O homo vide quid pro te patior’
_description: ‘O homo vide quid pro te patior’ — five couplets

NLS18721.First Lines:
Senful man beþing & seQuat peine i þole for loue of
                    þe…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…To me turne onis is eyȝeþan al þe peine
                    þat i dryȝe
NLS18721.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 88.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 208.
